meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of an aponeurosis.
meanings.sent1: The aponeurotic tissue provides strength and support to the body.
meanings.sent2: Her aponeurotic structure allowed for efficient movement.
meanings.sent3: The aponeurotic fibers were so strong, they could probably hold up a small car!
meanings.sent4: His determination was as aponeurotic as steel, unwavering in the face of challenges.
meanings.sent5: The aponeurotic nature of the bridge made it sturdy and reliable.

meanings.definition: Consisting of or resembling an aponeurosis.
meanings.sent1: The aponeurotic bandage provided firm support for the injury.
meanings.sent2: The aponeurotic appearance of the muscle indicated its strength.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her hair looked aponeurotic after using too much gel.
meanings.sent4: The relationship between them was aponeurotic, tightly bound and unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The aponeurotic design of the building ensured stability during earthquakes.
